name: TeneX AI Sourcing Agent
description: AI-native sourcing system using ephemeral E2B sandboxes with Claude Agent SDK (TypeScript) to discover engineering candidates from GitHub, HN, and Twitter

userStories.title: Set up TypeScript project structure
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the project scaffolded so I can start building components.
acceptanceCriteria: Create `src/` directory for main source code
Create `e2b-template/` directory for E2B template definition
Create `.env.example` with: ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, E2B_API_KEY, CONVEX_URL, GH_TOKEN

userStories.title: Create E2B template with Claude Code
userStories.description: As an orchestrator, I need a pre-built E2B template with Claude Code and gh CLI installed for fast sandbox spin-up.
acceptanceCriteria: Template installs apt packages: curl, git, ripgrep, gh
Create `e2b-template/build.ts` to build template with alias 'tenex-sourcing'
Template builds successfully with `npx tsx e2b-template/build.ts`
Sandbox.create('tenex-sourcing') works and has claude command available

userStories.title: Create Convex schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the database schema defined so agents can persist leads.
acceptanceCriteria: Create `convex/schema.ts` with tables: seedRepos, prospects, outreachDrafts, sourcingRuns
prospects table has fields: githubUsername, name, email, emailSource, twitterHandle, company, location, bio, discoveredFrom (array), confidenceTier, score, status, dateDiscovered
prospects table has indexes: by_github, by_tier, by_status
seedRepos table has fields: name, url, category, status, dateAdded
sourcingRuns table has fields: startedAt, completedAt, prospectsFound, errors

userStories.title: Create Convex functions for prospects
userStories.description: As an agent, I need CRUD functions to read/write prospects.
acceptanceCriteria: Create `convex/prospects.ts` with mutations: createProspect, updateProspect, upsertProspect
upsertProspect checks for existing githubUsername and updates if found
All functions have proper TypeScript types using Convex validators

userStories.title: Build GitHub researcher prompt
userStories.description: As a lead agent, I need a prompt that tells the GitHub researcher what to do.
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt instructs agent to use `gh` CLI commands
Prompt specifies output format: JSON with username, name, email, company, contributions
Prompt includes example commands: `gh api repos/.../contributors`, `gh api users/...`
Prompt tells agent to get email from commit history if not in profile

userStories.title: Build GitHub researcher module
userStories.description: As a sourcing system, I need to extract contributors from GitHub repos.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement `async function researchRepo(repo: string): Promise<Lead[]>` using Claude Agent SDK
Agent uses Bash tool with `gh` CLI
Returns list of leads with: username, name, email, emailSource, company, location, bio, twitter, contributions
Test: Run against `vercel-labs/agent-browser`, expect 5+ leads returned

userStories.title: Build HN researcher prompt
userStories.description: As a lead agent, I need a prompt for searching Hacker News.
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt instructs agent to use WebFetch with Algolia API
Prompt specifies output format: JSON with title, author, points, url
Prompt tells agent to search for seed repo names

userStories.title: Build HN researcher module
userStories.description: As a sourcing system, I need to find people posting about seed repos on HN.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement `async function searchHN(query: string): Promise<HNLead[]>` using Claude Agent SDK
Returns list with: hnUsername, storyTitle, points, url

userStories.title: Build observer/validator
userStories.description: As a security measure, I need to validate agent output before persisting.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement `async function validateLeads(rawOutput: string): Promise<Lead[] | null>`
Uses Claude Haiku to validate JSON schema
Returns null if output is invalid or suspicious
Returns cleaned list of leads if valid
Test: Valid JSON passes, malformed JSON returns null

userStories.title: Build E2B sandbox runner
userStories.description: As an orchestrator, I need to run agents in ephemeral E2B sandboxes.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement `async function runInSandbox(prompt: string, env: Record<string, string>): Promise<string>`
Passes environment variables (ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, GH_TOKEN) to sandbox
Test: Run simple prompt, verify output returned

userStories.title: Create seed repos configuration
userStories.description: As a user, I need to configure which repos to scan.
acceptanceCriteria: Export typed array of SeedRepo objects

userStories.title: Build Twitter/Nitter researcher prompt
userStories.description: As a lead agent, I need a prompt for searching Twitter via Nitter.
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt instructs agent to use WebFetch with Nitter (no login required)
Prompt specifies output format: JSON with twitterHandle, tweetText, likes, retweets
Prompt includes fallback Nitter instances: nitter.poast.org, nitter.privacydev.net

userStories.title: Build Twitter/Nitter researcher module
userStories.description: As a sourcing system, I need to find people tweeting about seed repos.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement `async function searchTwitter(query: string): Promise<TwitterLead[]>` using Claude Agent SDK
Agent uses WebFetch tool with Nitter frontend
Parses HTML response to extract: twitterHandle, tweetText, likes, retweets
Test: Search for 'agent-browser vercel', expect results with @handles

userStories.title: Build lead agent orchestrator
userStories.description: As a daily job, I need to coordinate all researchers and persist results.
acceptanceCriteria: Spawns GitHub researcher for each seed repo (can be parallel)
Spawns HN researcher for each seed repo
Spawns Twitter researcher for each seed repo
Persists valid leads to Convex via HTTP API
Test: Mock researchers, verify Convex calls made

userStories.title: Create CLI entry point
userStories.description: As a user, I need a CLI to run the sourcing agent manually or via cron.
acceptanceCriteria: Supports `pnpm run source` to run daily sourcing
Supports `pnpm run source --repo <repo>` to scan single repo
Prints summary of leads found at completion
